data.quote: The best mind-altering drug is the truth.

data.quote: Tell the children the truth.

data.quote: Materialism coarsens and petrifies everything, making everything vulgar, and every truth false.

data.quote: The bud of victory is always in the truth.

data.quote: Truth springs from argument amongst friends.

data.quote: Truth is weirder than any fiction I've seen.

data.quote: What the imagination seizes as beauty must be truth.

data.quote: Why would anyone lie? The truth is always more colorful.

data.quote: I've studied pathological liars, and anything they say, they believe, and that's one of the reasons they're so convincing, because they have no connection with the truth. data.quote: Everything deep is also simple and can be reproduced simply as long as its reference to the whole truth is maintained. But what matters is not what is witty but what is true.

data.quote: If now isn't a good time for the truth I don't see when we'll get to it.

data.quote: People think SEALs are cold-blooded, heartless, wound-up, brainwashed killers. They imagine you can just point a SEAL in a direction and say, 'Go kill.' The truth is you're talking about a bunch of kind-hearted, jovial guys. The only thing that separates them is mental toughness.

data.quote: Dear Internet: You are very good at spreading rumors. Truth is more valuable and much harder to come by.

data.quote: Truth is mysterious, elusive, always to be conquered. Liberty is dangerous, as hard to live with as it is elating. We must march toward these two goals, painfully but resolutely, certain in advance of our failings on so long a road.

data.quote: You don't have to be scared of me, because I am loyal. Why are people so scared of creative ideas and so scared of truth? All I want to do is do good.

data.quote: Truth is so much more interesting than the fiction we're used to.

data.quote: I believe in people. Human beings, deep down, are essentially good. Any jury can filter through whatever bull might be thrown their way and use common sense to get to the truth of a case. Juries make the right decisions, almost unfailingly, because people know right from wrong.

data.author: Thomas S. Monson

data.quote: If you see voters as rational, you'll be a terrible politician. People are not wired to be rational. Our brains simply evolved to keep us alive. Brains did not evolve to give us truth. Brains merely give us movies in our minds that keeps us sane and motivated. But none of it is rational or true, except maybe sometimes by coincidence.
data.author: Scott Adams

data.quote: I don't want any yes-men around me. I want everybody to tell me the truth even if it costs them their job.
data.author: Samuel Goldwyn

data.quote: What a word is truth. Slippery, tricky, unreliable. I tried in these books to tell the truth.
data.author: Lillian Hellman

data.quote: Above all, I would teach him to tell the truth Truth-telling, I have found, is the key to responsible citizenship. The thousands of criminals I have seen in 40 years of law enforcement have had one thing in common: Every single one was a liar.
data.author: J. Edgar Hoover

data.quote: Search for the truth. I tell you things and I always ask you to verify what I say. I told you yesterday that there was an attack and a retreat at Saddam's airport.
data.author: Mohammed Saeed al-Sahaf

data.quote: Accuracy of statement is one of the first elements of truth inaccuracy is a near kin to falsehood.
data.author: Tryon Edwards

data.quote: When distant and unfamiliar and complex things are communicated to great masses of people, the truth suffers a considerable and often a radical distortion. The complex is made over into the simple, the hypothetical into the dogmatic, and the relative into an absolute.
data.author: Walter Lippmann

data.quote: Everything you add to the truth subtracts from the truth.
data.author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

data.quote: The truth is balance. However the opposite of truth, which is unbalance, may not be a lie.
data.author: Susan Sontag

data.quote: A lie would have no sense unless the truth were felt dangerous.
data.author: Alfred Adler

data.quote: Every great discovery I ever made, I gambled that the truth was there, and then I acted in faith until I could prove its existence.
data.author: Arthur H. Compton

data.quote: You must have love as the core it takes courage to be willing to constantly tell the truth to each other and risk letting the relationship go.
data.author: Kenny Loggins

data.quote: When I saw corruption, I was forced to find truth on my own. I couldn't swallow the hypocrisy.
data.author: Barry White

data.quote: I don't think Bosnia is ready for reconciliation, but I do think it is ready for truth.
data.author: Paddy Ashdown

data.quote: The inquiries of the jurist are in truth prosecuted much as inquiry in physic and physiology was prosecuted before observation had taken the place of assumption.
data.author: Henry James Sumner Maine

data.quote: It's a great thriller or mystery, but on another level it's a film about the fact that, if you only look at a person through one lens, or only believe what you're told, you can often miss the truth that is staring you in the face.
data.author: Kevin Spacey

data.quote: Everybody now admits that apartheid was wrong, and all I did was tell the people who wanted to know where I come from how we lived in South Africa. I just told the world the truth. And if my truth then becomes political, I can't do anything about that.
data.author: Miriam Makeba

data.quote: Let us be a little humble let us think that the truth may not perhaps be entirely with us.
data.author: Jawaharlal Nehru

data.quote: What I claim is to live to the full the contradiction of my time, which may well make sarcasm the condition of truth.
data.author: Roland Barthes
